How to watch The Grand Tour: Jeremy Clarkson’s new car show on Amazon Prime is nearly here

Cars

Jeremy Clarkson's new car show is coming soon. Here's how to watch The Grand Tour

Curtis Moldrich
@khurtizz
20 Jun 2016
  • whatsapp
  • facebook
  • twitter
  • google+
  • linkedin
  • reddit
  • email
  • 11

Top Gear is back, but not as we know it. After a ‘fracas’ with a producer, Jeremy Clarkson and the old team has gone, and they’ve been replaced with a larger, all-new cast lead by Chris Evans and Matt LeBlanc. Since the show launched, ratings have been down, and apart from the refreshing Extra Gear spin-off, reviews for the main show and Evans in particular have been rather negative. But what about the old trio of Clarkson, Hammond and May? Well, this year, the old Top Gear team are coming back to our screens with a new car show calld The Grand Tour – and it’s going to be on Amazon Prime.  So, interested in seeing what Clarkson and the ‘original’ Top Gear team does next? Here’s how to watch The Grand Tour on Amazon Prime.

How to watch the Grand Tour on Amazon Prime

The best-value way to watch The Grand Tour is to pay the £79 annual fee for Amazon Prime, but there is another way: subscribing to Amazon Prime Video on its own for £6 per month. The only issue? Prime Video works out at around £72 per year, which doesn’t look cheap compared to the complete Prime package. For Prime Video, free delivery and more, Amazon only charges an extra £7 over 12 months (although, again, you must pay in one lump sum; the Video-only option is paid monthly).

The Grand Tour: All you need to know

Jeremy Clarkson's new car show will kick off in Johannesburg

When Clarkson, Hammond and May first announced the name of The Grand Tour, they said the new show would film with a live studio audience in locations across teh world, and the team have just revealed where the show will start. A Facebook post on The Grand Tour Facebook page has revealed the new show is kicking off in the city of Johannesburg, South Africa and goes on to say that tickets will be released through a prize draw later this summer. While it’s not clear how to apply for tickets, signing up to The Grand Tour mailing list is probably the best course of action.

It's going to be called The Grand Tour

See related 
Best Kodi addons 2016 UK: The 14 best XBMC extensions to stream movies, sports, football and more
Jeremy Clarkson thinks hydrogen fuel is the future of cars
WATCH THIS: Possible production Tesla Model 3 spotted in the wild

After months of suggestions, Jeremy Clarkson and the team have finally revealed the name of their new car show, The Grand Tour. According to Clarkson, the thinking behind the show's name was pretty simple – and gives us some more insight into what to expect. 

“We’ll be travelling the world hosting each episode in a different country, from a giant tent," said Clarkson. "It’s a sort of ‘grand tour’, if you like. So we’ve decided to call it The Grand Tour.

At the same time, Clarkson also revealed a link to the show's new Facebook page, as well as a video showing just how the team came up with the new name. Of course, it's now known that Clarkson's new Amazon Prime show wasn't allowed to have the word "gear" in the name, so that could be why the naming process took so long.

Filming started in October

Thanks to a tweet from Clarkson last year, we know filming started at the beginning of October.

However, we have a rough idea when it will land on Amazon Prime. In a Reddit AMA last month, James May said that, while he couldn’t be drawn on a specific date, we should expect the new series to arrive in “the autumn, or fall if you're in the US”.

The trio has signed up to three seasons of the show, but more could follow, depending on how things go.

The show will be a worldwide affair

When it finally airs, the show will be broadcast very differently to the old Top Gear. Because Amazon Prime is a worldwide service, it appears the new motoring series will be available across territories, so US subscribers will be able to watch at the same time as their UK counterparts.

The way the new series will be presented will be international too: Clarkson and the team will host the show from a different location in the world every week.

The Grand Tour: Everything else

Netflix gets the rights to the new Top Gear

When Clarkson, May and Hammond left the BBC last year, most people – including myself – thought they’d be heading to Sky, ITV or Netflix. According to a new report on The Drum, Netflix will instead pick up the new series of Top Gear. Netflix’s chief content officer, Ted Sarandos, said: “Theoretically, it should follow the deal of the old format, where Top Gear is still under the terms of the old deal.

“So, in many parts of the world, we already have it picked up and we’ll continue to talk to them about doing it as well. The show is very popular on Netflix, as you can imagine.”

Interestingly, Netflix is also keen to get the rights to the UK version of the show, as it tends to do better than the localised, licensed versions. “There’s a change in format, but people definitely prefer the British Top Gear over the local Top Gear in almost every country in the world,” added Sarandos.

We haven’t heard much about what will be on The Grand Tour, but one look at the social media accounts of the three presenters gives us a good idea of what to expect. May, Hammond and Clarkson are all very active on social media, and they’ve suggested the new show will have exactly the same tone as their Top Gear series. 

Jeremy Clarkson on Amazon Prime: How it happened

According to The Independent, the team decided to go with Amazon Prime not for money, but for freedom. Reports suggest that the team were in talks with ITV first, but it was clear they wouldn’t get the creative freedom they craved. As for Netflix? It just wasn’t interested.

Andy Wilman, a producer on the show and a key part of the Clarkson team, said: “We love the people down at ITV, but we couldn't do it.” Talking about Amazon he said: “Everyone we have talked to has told us: ‘They leave you alone to make your show.’ That's a big one for us – we don’t like interference, we don’t need to be policed.”

“Customers told us they wanted to see the team back on screen, and we are excited to make that happen,” added Jay Marine, vice president of Amazon Prime Video EU. “Millions of Prime members are already enjoying our groundbreaking original shows. We can’t wait to see what Jeremy, Richard, James and the team will create in what is sure to be one of the most globally anticipated shows of 2016.”

The deal will see one of terrestrial television’s most popular presenters move to an online-only platform, providing another example of the growing power of streaming.

Will it beat Netflix?

While Amazon Prime appears to offer a lot, it has struggled with content.

Prime Video’s current exclusives fall flat when compared to Netflix exclusives such as House of Cards and Daredevil, while the Prime Music service only features one million songs, compared to Apple Music and Spotify’s 30 million.

Yet, by signing Jeremy Clarkson and the rest of the Top Gear gang, Amazon is adding popular, attractive content to boost its already impressive value. When combined with new exclusive shows such as The Man in the High Castle, Amazon Prime Video is getting ready to take the fight to Netflix this year. Throw in great value, and it just might win.
